page.title: 06Penarth Principal Features
page.content: Penarth is a small coastal town. It was built mostly for its docks which were used, like Cardiff 5 miles away, to export coal. Now the docks are closed and Penarth has become a residential town.{Llandough Hospital covering about 7 acres of land, is not only used as a hospital, but is also used as a training hospital and as an old peoples' home. The{Town Hall} is in the centre of the town, and this year the Town Mayor is{Dr.Sibert}who works at Llandough Hospital. The {Lifeboat Station}is on the Esplanade. Further along the coast there is a {Coastguard Lookout Station.}On the seafront there is a{Pier}which is used for fishing, and pleasure boats like the Waverly call there to pick up passengers in the summertime. Just off the coast there are two islands,{Flat {Holm and Steep Holm.}
